Class KiBasicPermission

java.lang.Object
  src.java.org.apache.ki.grails.KiBasicPermission
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.ki.authz.Permission
class KiBasicPermission

A basic permission class that can be used with the default DB realm provided with the plugin.

Constructor Detail

KiBasicPermission

public KiBasicPermission(java.lang.String target, java.lang.String actions)
Creates a new permission with the given actions. Note an action may not have any whitespace in it, or ',' or ';' characters.
param:
target The permission target. The meaning of 'target' is application dependent, for example it may be a file path, a URL, a controller name, or a component name.
param:
actions A string of actions separated by ',', ';', or whitespace. For example, 'view,edit', 'create, delete', 'create; modify', 'view edit' are all valid two-action strings.

KiBasicPermission

public KiBasicPermission(java.lang.String target, java.util.Collection actions)
Creates a new permission with the given actions.
param:
target The permission target. The meaning of 'target' is application dependent, for example it may be a file path, a URL, a controller name, or a component name.
param:
actions A collection of action strings, for example 'view' 'edit', 'create', and 'delete'.

 
Method Detail

actionsStringToSet

protected java.util.Set actionsStringToSet(java.lang.String actions)
Converts a delimiter-separated string of actions into a set of actions. Supported delimiters are ',', ';', and whitespace.

actionsToString

protected java.lang.String actionsToString(java.util.Collection actions)
Converts a collection of actions into a comma-separated string. For example, 'view,edit,create,delete'. Note that there is no whitespace in the resulting string.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

getActions

public java.util.Set getActions()
Returns an unmodifiable set of this permission's actions.

getActionsString

public java.lang.String getActionsString()
Returns this permission's actions as a comma-separated string, for example 'view,create,modify,delete'.

hashCode

public int hashCode()

implies

public boolean implies(Permission p)
Returns true if this permission implies the given one, otherwise false. This method checks that this permission has the same target as the given permission and a super-set of the actions. The wildcard matches all targets and all actions.
